verb.description: Cut (something) with scissors or shears, typically with small quick strokes.
examples: she inspected the embroidery, snipping at loose threads
she snipped layers into the hair around her face

noun.description: An act of cutting something with small quick strokes.
examples: he took a snip at a dandelion on the grass

noun.description: A surprisingly cheap item; a bargain.
examples: the wine is a snip at Â£2.65

noun.description: Hand shears, especially for cutting metal.

examples: imagine that little snip telling me I was wrong!

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense a shred): from Low German snip small piece, of imitative origin.
